properties.name: Ainsworth Horse #1
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior3125 NE Ainsworth, PortlandNE Ainsworth must have been a popular horse riding street back in the day, because there\'s lots of rings between NE 33rd and NE 20th.

properties.name: Ainsworth and MLK Mare
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior101 NE Ainsworth, PortlandThis horsey likes to be where the action is, just a few blocks from NE MLK Blvd.

properties.name: American Dream Steed
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior4620 Northeast Glisan Street, Portland, OR, 97213At least two horses have been stolen from here, there was a cable tie, uncut, and then someone put in another using a ribbon tie, which was mangled and broken. I replaced it with another ribbon tie and this time glued the horse to the curb and the rubbon tie to the horse and the ribbon to the wire tie. Hopefully this one will last!

properties.name: Doctor's Office Steed
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior1432 SE 51st St., PortlandA doctor/friend of mine was so excited to learn about the Horse Project and find out more about the couple of horses she had seen on Belmont that I had to leave one just north of Hawthorne on SE 51st St. to brighten her days. This one can\'t decide whether to race one of the cars or the bicycle. I\'m betting on the horse no matter what.

properties.name: Downtown Horse #1
properties.description: Posted by WinkjuniorMy first attempt at a horse downtown. They don\'t seem to last long, but what the heck, why not, let\'s see how it goes.

properties.name: Hawthorne Horsey
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior5013 SE Hawthorne St., PortlandThis horse found a home with the help of a relator... or at least in front of one. Didn\'t realize there was a pink My Little Pony just nearby, because it was so small, but they\'re already the best of friends.

properties.name: Irvington Stallion #007
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior1608 NE Brazee St.

properties.name: J&M Cafe Horse
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior 538 Ash St., PortlandHere are pics of the original horse and her replacement. The first one confirmed what I had suspected - if the horses aren\'t glued to the curb and the tie is too long, they fall off the curb onto the street and get run over. So from now on, I\'m keep the wire ties as short sa I can and gluing their hooves with Goop - I think they\'ll last much much longer because I think the "horse thieves" are only a minor cause of missing horses.

properties.name: Lonely Planey Pony
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior925 NW Everett St.

properties.name: Lumpy but Vintage Pony
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior1515 SE 48th St., PortlandA great new vintage furniture and knick-knack store was fun to browse and recommended by a friend, and the clerk was full of energy and funny and helpful (unlike most places in Portland) so in her honor, I had to put a horse in front. Her motto: "Life is Lumpy!"

properties.name: Main Post Office
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior811 NW Hoyt St.

properties.name: Marsee Mare
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior1723 NE 10th Ave., PortlandThis lucky horse got the real treatment soon after being left, within a day it had a packet of sugar to go with its cube, and a plastic "bowl" of water.

properties.name: Mississippi Pizza Mare
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior3552 N Mississippi Ave, PortlandThe horse in front of Mississippi Pizza is still there after three weeks. Decided it needed another picture.

properties.name: Mississippi Studios Horse
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior3938 N. Mississippi, Portland, ORAcross the street (east side) from Mississippi Studios on a new ring. Let\'s hope this one lasts longer than the location a block south where two have been stolen. He\'s eyeballing my motorcycle, looking for a race. I declined - never bet against a horse.

properties.name: Muddy Pony Stolen
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior3560 N. Mississippi, Portland, ORThis one was stolen.

properties.name: Multi-Cultural Church Pony
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior 2941 NE Ainsworth, PortlandThis pony decided to make herself available to be played with by children attending this multi-racial, multi-cultural church on Ainsworth. A better purpose in left I could not imagine.

properties.name: NE Knott & 24th Pony
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior2437 NE Knott St., PortlandSomeone stole the horse that Laura put on NE Knott near 24th St. so when I was bicycling by I stopped to replace it with this black lovely.

properties.name: NE Weidler Pony
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior2089 NE Weidler St., Portland, ORA very busy commute route will no doubt keep this steed busy as well, and hopefully appreciated by all those passing by in the bicycle lane it watches over. If you see it, please give it some love and food & water if you have any.

properties.name: Old Hotel Horsey
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior 1529 NE 21st Ave., Portland, ORFound a ring in front of an old hotel turned apartment building on NE 21st, a major bicycle throughfare. Hope she\'ll be happy there and the tenants will take good care of her.

properties.name: Pink Pony on Hawthorne
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior5012 SE Hawthorne St., PortlandA pink My Little Pony right next to SE 50th and Hawthorne. Poor little thing lost a leg but says she\'s hoping to get some surgery soon.

properties.name: Portland Bld. Pony
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior303 NE Portland, PortlandThis little pony also likes to be hear the action as well as a MAX stop, so she made her home just a block away. That way she can visit the horses downtown without having to drive or risk blowing out a horseshoe. And the prices of oats has been going up even faster than that of gasoline! Fortunately her nice friend Trina Superstar was around to offer her a treat!

properties.name: Post Office Pony
properties.description: Posted by WinkjuniorThe Pony Express taunts the competition across the street from the U.S. Post Office.

properties.name: Post Office Pony
properties.description: Posted by WinkjuniorA Pony Express horse taunts the U.S. Post Office from across the street.

properties.name: Rebuilding Center Stallion
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior3551 N Mississippi Ave, PortlandThird time\'s a charm - another horse has moved in front of the Rebuilding Center. I wonder if people going there tend to have tools and keep liberating the horses, but again the tie wasn\'t cut.

properties.name: Retired Pony Express Horse
properties.description: Posted by WinkjuniorRight next door to a Post Office, a retired Pony Express horse lives in an old apartment building, trying to eke out an existence on Social Security and living in squaller, wishing he had managed to get a job with the USPS when the Express went bankrupt.

properties.name: Sapphire Hotel Horsey
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior 5003 SE Hawthorne St., PortlandThe Sapphire Hotel has hosted two horses previously, and the owners were very happy to hear that a new horse was going to make her home there. They promised to watch and feed and take care of her.

properties.name: Siskiyou Steed
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior4211 NE Siskiyou St., PortlandWhere NE Siskiyou comes into a weird bend of the Alameda in NE Portland, there was a ring on a corner that desperately needed a horse. He\'s very happy being there, it being a very posh and upscale neighborhood.

properties.name: Stanton Street Steed
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior4489 NE Stanton St., PortlandA My Little Pony was going to live here but a neighbor was walking by so we let her pick out the horse to live here. She promised to blow it kisses whenever she walks by and make sure it\'s standing up.

properties.name: The Alameda Horse #1
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior4041 NE Alameda, PortlandHere\'s a horse someone put on Alameda. It doesn\'t have a wire rope tie, just twisted wire, but it\'s lasted. Will probably put a proper tie on it some time soonl, but good to know some neighborhoods are "safer" from them durned horse thieves!

properties.name: The Mad/50 Stallion
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior5004 SE Madison St., PortlandThe house near here has tons of artwork landscaping and is one of the coolest houses in Portland, and thought the deserved a horse to help keep an eye on things. This one was named by the owners.

properties.name: Woodstock Library Horse
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior6008 SE 49th Ave., PortlandThis horse got Rock Star Parking right in front of the Woodstock Multnomah Library! Hopefully a lot of kids will get to play with him.

properties.name: Woodstock Mystery Mare
properties.description: Posted by Winkjunior4640 SE Woodstock, PortlandThis mare is living near the infamous Woodstock Mystery Hole ("Just 2 Miles Off I-205!") and is dedicated to the always amazing Rev. Barron, curator of the Mystery Hole. She\'s helping keep an eye on the neighborhood and hoping to keep the new condos nearby from being too boring. Lots of love to you Rev. Barron!
